title: Download an image from a message

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: A short-term access token authorized by the TikTok Business Account owner. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok Business Account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: Conversation ID. To get the conversation ID, use /business/message/conversation/list/ .

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Message ID. To get a message ID, use /business/message/content/list/ .

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: Media ID. To get a media ID, use /business/message/content/list/ .

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.description: Multimedia type. Currently, we only support IMAGE as the multimedia type.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: download_url
fields.description: Download URL. It is valid for 24 hours. If it expires, call this endpoint again to generate a new URL. Note : When downloading the image through the URL, you must include a header. Set the header to x-user = {{Access-Token}} .
